name: Tarski's exponential function problem
rephrased: Is the theory of the real numbers, including the exponential function, decidable?
explained: Tarski's exponential function problem is a question in mathematical logic, specifically in model theory. It asks whether the theory of the real numbers, when augmented with the exponential function (i.e., the function xmapsto e^x), remains decidable. Alfred Tarski had previously demonstrated that the elementary theory of the real numbers alone (without the exponential function) is decidable. The conjecture, therefore, concerns the impact of adding this specific transcendental function on the decidability property of the real numbers' theory.
